page.title: 06EAST HANNINGFIELD
page.content: EAST HANNINGFIELD {East Hanningfield} is a village, surrounded by flat farmland, adjoining Bicknacre on its north-east boundary and approximately 4 miles to the east boundary of{Chelmsford.} The population of 1000 has increased by two-thirds during the last 4 years. Four new estates have been built in discreet positions so as to preserve the{old-world}look of the village. The 100-year old{church}replaces the Saxon one that was destroyed by fire and stands on the main road at the north entrance to the village. The{Southend-Chelmsford}bus runs through the village hourly,offering regular transport for workers at the small industries. There are 2 public houses,a modern Church of England school, and a popular post office and general stores
